(A1 → A29).natural: Whenever grain storage requires quality control, inventory is stocked.

(A1 → G).natural: If grain storage requires quality control, then the operation is profitable.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either grain storage requires quality control or production line requires quality control.

(A100 → (A18 → A17)).natural: Under the condition that production capacity is increased, if procedures are documented then protocols are followed.

(A100 ∨ A101).natural: Production capacity is increased or facilities are expanded.

(A101 → (A18 → A17)).natural: Provided that facilities are expanded, if procedures are documented then protocols are followed.

(A104 → (¬(¬(A100 ∨ A101) → ¬A102) → A10.natural: Whenever technology is invested in, if it is not the case that either production capacity is not increased or facilities are not expanded leads to resources not being constrained, then growth targets are achieved.

(A104 → A105).natural: If technology is invested in, then processes are automated.

(A105 → (¬(¬(A100 ∨ A101) → ¬A102) → A10.natural: If processes are automated, then provided that it is not the case that either production capacity is not increased or facilities are not expanded implies resources are not constrained, growth targets are achieved.

(A106 → (A104 → A105)).natural: Supposing funding is secured, if technology is invested in then processes are automated.

(A11 → A10).natural: Whenever assembly line is finished, final product is completed.

(A12 → (A11 → A10)).natural: Given that food samples are tested, if assembly line is finished then final product is completed.

(A13 → A12).natural: If quality data is collected, then food samples are tested.

(A15 → A14).natural: If quality reports are reviewed, then lab results are analyzed.
